commands.wedit:jumpto.description: Teleport you to the top of the block you're looking at
commands.wedit:jumpto.none: No block in sight (or too far)!

commands.wedit:line.description: Create a line between your first and second selection points

commands.wedit:pos2.description: Set the second position of your selection to the specified or current position
commands.wedit:range.description: Set how far a brush can be used from
commands.wedit:redo.description: Redo a certain amount of actions
commands.wedit:replace.description: Replace certain blocks in the selection with other blocks
commands.wedit:replacenear.description: Replace nearby blocks with other blocks
commands.wedit:rotate.yOnly: You can only rotate along the Y axis!

commands.wedit:sel.sphere: Sphere selector: tap while sneaking for the center, tap without sneaking to set radius
commands.wedit:set.description: Fill the selection with a block pattern
commands.wedit:setbiome.changed: Biomes were changed for approximately %s blocks.

commands.wedit:thaw.description: Melt snow and ice exposed to the sky
commands.wedit:stack.description: Repeat the contents of the current selection
commands.wedit:smooth.description: Smooth the surface within the selection
commands.wedit:thru.description: Teleport through any wall you look at

commands.wedit:descend.obstructed: No free spot under you found.
commands.wedit:tracemask.description: Set what kind of blocks a brush can be used on

commands.wedit:tool.description.farwand: Selection tool, but can reach farther
commands.wedit:tool.description.cmd: Command exeution tool; both vanilla and worldedit
commands.wedit:tool.unbind: Tool unbound from your current item.
commands.wedit:undo.description: Undo a certain amount of actions
commands.wedit:up.description: Move up a certain number of blocks
commands.wedit:wall.description: Generate a wall from your selection
commands.wedit:wand.explain: Sneak and tap block: select pos
commands.wedit:worldedit.description.per: Toggle performance mode for the current session.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.title: How to Play: Quick Start to WorldEdit
howtoplay.wedit:license.title: How to Play: WorldEdit License
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.1: Welcome! This is a port of the original WorldEdit mod for Minecraft: Java Edition. This addon will help you shape your world right inside Minecraft.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.2: By default, players are not allowed to use WorldEdit. Only those tagged with worldedit permission can use its features. To give yourself permission, enter §e/tag @s add worldedit§r in chat. You should now have access to every WorldEdit command.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.3: §l§aTip:§r§a You can also give other players permission by changing §e@s§r§a to the player's name. You'll need to surround it in quotes if it has a space in it. Eg: §e/tag "Steve Wanderer" add worldedit§r
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.4: §l§aNotice:§r§a The commands provided by this addon use a semicolon (;) instead of a forward slash (/). In the future, Mojang might add actual custom commands support to Minecraft.§r
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.5: Getting from point A to point B can sometimes be a hassle. Luckily, this addon comes with what's known as a Navigation Wand. To get one, enter the command §e;navwand§r. Once you have this item, just interact with it to get teleported to the spot you are looking at. Want to get on the otherside of a wall or ceiling? Use the wand while sneaking to go right through it! Stuck in a block? Using the wand will get you unstuck!
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.6: §l§aTip:§r§a If you don't want to use the navigation wand, these actions can also be done with the commands §e;jumpto§r§a, §e;thru§r§a and §e;unstuck§r§a as well§r.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.7: Like the original mod, you use what's known as a Selection Wand to easily mark regions of your world for various operations. To get one, grab a wooden axe, or enter the command §e;wand§r. Selections in WorldEdit are cuboid shaped by default. To make a selection, you need to mark the two corners of this cuboid. You mark the first corner by using the wand on a block at that corner while sneaking. You mark the second point by using it on a block §lwithout§r sneaking. If done correctly, you should see a highlight of your selection.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.8: If there's no block for you to mark a corner with, like high in the air, you can also use the commands §e;pos1§r or §e;pos2§r to mark the first and second corner respectively, as the position you are currently standing in. This is not the same as the position you are standing §lon§r.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.9: Make a modest sized selection to work with and get your kit ready with §e;kit§r. We're going to try some of the features WorldEdit has to offer.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.10: §71. Place down stone, use the Pattern Picker on it and then use "Fill Selection". A cuboid of stone should be made.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.11: §r2. Use the Pattern Picker on the air (mobile players must hold the screen with it) and use "Fill Selection" again to clear the stone.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.12: §73. Place down sandstone and glass, use the Pattern Picker on the sandstone, and sneak and use it on the glass to add to your pattern. Use "Fill Selection" and you should have a mix of sandstone and glass.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.13: §r4. Take out the Mask Picker in your inventory and use it on the sandstone. Set a block of your choice as your pattern, and use "Fill Selection". All sandstone should now be replaced with that block.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.14: §75. Repeat your selection upwards by typing the command §e;stack 4 up§r§7.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.15: If you want to you can undo everthing by using the undo item until you can't undo any further.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.16: 1. Get a shovel of any type, and place down cobblestone; you'll need it for the brush.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.17: §72. Use the "WorldEdit Settings" item. A menu should appear including "Brush Settings". Select that button, then create a new brush as the interface instructs you. Make it a sphere brush of radius 3, and a cobblestone pattern. Confirm the settings and exit the menu.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.18: §r3. Aim at the ground not near you and interact with the shovel (now brush) to place cobblestone spheres.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.19: §74. Enter the brush settings again to set the mask for the brush to `grass`. Use the brush now to make a cobblestone path.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.20: §r5. Delete the brush from the menu to disable it.
howtoplay.wedit:quick_start.text.23: To learn more about this addon, you can go to its online documentation here: §ehttps://worldedit-be-docs.readthedocs.io§r
